sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"一对，一双"之意。
means: couple ： 多指在一起或彼此有关系的两个人或两个同样的事物。
pair ： 含义广泛，可指人或物。用于物时，指两个互属的事物，缺此或失彼都会失去使用价值，或指由相对称的两部分构成的一件东西。

word_mean: 对，偶：两个有关的、相似的或者相同的实体或物体的结合

sentence.Network_en: On the mantelpiece are a pair of bronze Ming vases.
sentence.Network_cn: 壁炉台上是一对明代的青铜花瓶。

sentence.Network_en: Eventually they reached a pair of ornately carved doors.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们最终来到一扇雕刻精美的对开门前。

sentence.Network_en: His surgical instruments were a knife and a pair of pincers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的外科手术器械是一把刀和一把钳子。

jx.jx_en_mean: used in reference to a person seen in terms of their participation in a task

lj.lj_ly: we can always do with an extra pair of hands.
lj.lj_ls: 我们从不反对多一个人帮忙。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French paire, from Latin paria 'equal things', neuter plural of par 'equal'. Formerly phrases such as a pair of gloves were expressed without of, as in a pair gloves (compare with German ein Paar Handschuhe)

encyclopedia.content: 社交应用 你有没有过这样的烦恼？自己与情侣的甜言蜜语被其他用户看到，又或者两人之间的私人相片不小心传到公共相册，引来不必要的围观。为了让情侣私人分享信息没有后顾之忧，创业孵化器Y Combinator旗下公司开发出了一款充满爱意的手机应用程序——Pair。 Pair只允许情侣间一对一使用。开始使用时，用户需要拍摄自己的照片和一段视频，然后再向自己的另一半发送邀请。对方接受后，双方便可以在Pair中进行各种交流与分享。Pair

entry.def: A pair of things are two things of the same size and shape that are used together or are both part of something, for example shoes, earrings, or parts of the body.

example.ex: ...trainers that cost up to 90 pounds a pair...
example.tran: 售价高达90英镑一双的运动鞋

entry.tran: 套，条，把，副（由两个尺寸和形状相同的部分组成的物品，如裤子、剪刀）
entry.def: Some objects that have two main parts of the same size and shape are referred to as a pair, for example a pair of trousers or a pair of scissors .

entry.tran: 一对伴儿；一对夫妻；一对情侣
entry.def: You can refer to two people as a pair when they are standing or walking together or when they have some kind of relationship with each other.

example.ex: A pair of teenage boys were smoking cigarettes...
example.tran: 两个十来岁的男孩正在吸烟。

example.ex: The pair admitted that their three-year-old marriage was going through 'a difficult time'...
example.tran: 那对夫妻承认他们3年的婚姻正在经历一个“困难期”。

entry.def: If one thing is paired with another, it is put with it or considered with it.

example.ex: The trainees will then be paired with experienced managers.
example.tran: 实习生随后将会与经验丰富的经理结成对子。

entry.tran: 可靠的好帮手；可以委托的人
entry.def: If you say that someone is or has a safe pair of hands, you mean that they are reliable and will not make any serious mistakes.

example.ex: He has now held five cabinet posts and remains a safe pair of hands.
example.tran: 他现在担任5个内阁职位，仍是一个靠得住的人。

means.word_mean: 1. a set of two similar things considered as a unit
2. two items of the same kind
3. two people considered as a unit
4. a poker hand with 2 cards of the same value
2. bring two objects, ideas, or people together;

sentences.sentence: "This fact is coupled to the other one"
"Matchmaker, can you match my daughter with a nice young man?"
"The student was paired with a partner for collaboration on the project"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bring birth,表示"生产,生出小孩"; 2. =come in sight,表示"看见;出现"; 3. =get ready,表示"准备;安置"; 4. =equal,表示"平等"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一胎多子的, 经产的, 非初产的, [植]多产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: multi多+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→多生产的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 初产的, 初次分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: primi=prim第一,最初+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→adj.初产的, 初次分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每次产一个卵的; 每胎生一子的
stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→生出一个

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表面上的,貌似真实的;显然的,明明白白的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+par看见;出现+ent……的→一再能看见→显而易见
trans横穿+par看见;出现+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
in不+separable[adj.可分离的, 可分的]→adj.不能分的
se分离+par置+able……的→adj.可分离的, 可分的
se分离+par置+ate表形容词→adj.分开的, 分离的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un无+prepare准备+ed……的→adj.无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可比较的, 比得上的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compare比较+able……的→adj.可比较的, 比得上的
compare比较+ative表形容词→adj.比较的, 相当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 奇数的,不成对的,不平等
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+parity[n.同等;奇偶]→adj.奇数的,不成对的,不平等
non不,无+par平等+eil→无平等的→无与伦比的
apparent显然的+ly表副词→adv.显然地
separate分开+ly表副词→adv.个别地;分离地
comparative[adj.比较的, 相当的]+ly表副词→adv.比较地, 相当地
par生产,生出小孩+ent……人→n.父母,母亲;[n.]双亲;父母

stems_affixes.value_cn: 透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃
stems_affixes.word_buile: transparent[[adj.透明的]]→n.透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器械,器具,仪器;机构,组织
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap=ad+par准备;安置+atus表名词→准备好用的东西→设备
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
prepare准备+ation行为,过程→n.准备, 预备
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com一起+pari=par平等+son→一起平等→比较
dis不+parity同等→n.不同,差异
par平等→n.一对, 一双
par平等+ity表名词→n.同等;奇偶
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
pre预先+par准备;安置+e→预先准备好
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com共同+par平等+e→平等的放在一起→比较
dis不+par平等+age动词后缀→不平等对待→轻视

Sentence.sentence: Researchers also observed problems resulting from pairing interracial students in residences.
The interracial roommates spent less time together, and had fewer joint activities than the white pairs.
They generally spend more time together that white pairs

Pairs of socks are pinned together.

sentences.cn: 两个强盗正试图绑架他的妻子。

means.word_mean: 一对男女, 一对夫妇

sentences.en: They will make a good pair.
sentences.cn: 他俩能结成美满的伉俪。

sentences.en: You are a fine pair coming as late as this!
sentences.cn: 你俩来得这么晚, 真是一对宝货！

sentences.cn: 一对黄鹂飞落在拂动着的柳树枝条上。

sentences.en: The pair of swans nested by the river.
This is a coach and pair.
I thought those two would pair well.
sentences.cn: 我认为那两个人将能配成很好的一对。

sentences.en: Birds pair and build nests in spring.

jushi.english: There are two pairs of shoes under the bed.
